alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:50PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster and southeastern Greene Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 250 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North-South Lake Campground, or 7 miles northwest of Saugerties, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North-South Lake Campground, Germantown, Centerville, Asbury, Canoe Hill, West Saugerties, Quarryville, Platte Clove, Manorville, Katsbaan, Malden-On-Hudson, Eavesport, Bingham Mills, Haines Falls, Mountain House, Blue Mountain, Palenville, Alsen, Elka Park and Cementon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Greene
